Temporary thread for lifespans

By Infernus on Monday, July 26, 2004 - 06:49 pm:

We seriously need to get these done, and with the ability to do 5 at once, it should be THAT hard.

Anyway, just some simple guidlines:
1: Make sure they are born on week 1 of any given month
2: Feed them on week 4. When they get fat/chubby, feed on week 2 and 4. You should use the more standard foods, i.e carrots, potatos, mangos.
3: Rest all their lives
4: Record all stages (you'll know by the statements). Record the week you are going to in the age. So, if you get the message as you are entering week 4, and your monster is 10 months old, the age for stage 2 is 10mo4wk.

I'll be posting later today most likely, so it should be more clear as to what you are supposed to do. I am currently working on Durahan, Beaklon, Dragon, Baku, and Ducken. As far as I know, Dark Palidan may be doing Golem, Zuum, Mew, Hare, and Tiger.

Remember, you can do 1 monster at a time and still train 4...

Pures only...for now. Post what you are doing before you start...

By Iron_Datu on Friday, September 24, 2004 - 07:05 am:

Here are the results for the Golem, Zuum, Tiger, Hare, and Mew lifespan tests.

Note:
1) Hare ate only carrot, Golem ate only potato, all others ate peach and mango.
2) All gadgets were removed from the ranch prior to their birth
3) All the creatures were shrined from the book
4) All the guidelines were followed

Golem- Subject Alpha
Birth: 5/1
Stage 2: 11mo/2wk
Stage 3: 2yr/2mo/2wk
Stage 4: 3yr/5mo/2wk
Stage 5: 4yr/4mo/3wk
Retirement: 4yr/8mo/1wk

Zuum- Subject Delta
Birth: 5/1
Stage 2: 10mo/4wk
Stage 3: 2yr/0mo/4wk
Stage 4: 3yr/3mo/1wk
Stage 5: 4yr/1mo/3wk
Retirement: 4yr/5mo/1wk

Tiger- Subject Theta
Birth: 5/1
Stage 2: 10mo/2wk
Stage 3: 1yr/11mo/4wk
Stage 4: 3yr/1mo/1wk
Stage 5: 3yr/11mo/2wk
Retirement:4yr/2mo/3wk

Hare-Subject Epsilon

Stage 2: 10mo/3wk
Stage 3: 2yr/0mo/3wk
Stage 4: 3yr/2mo/2wk
Stage 5: 4yr/0mo/4wk
Retirement: 4yr/4mo/1wk

Mew-Subject Omega

By joenuts on Friday, October 14, 2005 - 07:16 am:

I have a question about the lifespans for sub-breeds. In the FAQ->Lifespans it states "For monsters with sub breeds, the lifespan formula is Main+Main+Sub=#, then #/3". Where is the Sub number supplied? For instance, if I raise a durahan/dragon, lifespan would be 216 weeks + 196 weeks + ??? = magic number, then divide magic number by 3 to get total life span. I'm a bit confused, is it something that I'm completely missing? Thanks

By Lisa Shock on Friday, October 14, 2005 - 11:21 am:

Sub is shorthand for sub-breed, in this case Dragon is your sub. Your main is Durahan.

By Seize on Sunday, February 3, 2008 - 02:35 pm:

Hello, I thought I would try to help fill in a few holes in the FAQ lifespan section.

Ogyo
Stage 2: 10m 4w
Stage 3: 2y 1m 1w
Stage 4: 3y 3m 2w
Stage 5: 4y 2m 1w
End: 4y 5m 3w

Ripper
Stage 2: 10m 1w
Stage 3: 1y 11m 1w
Stage 4: 3y 0m 1w
Stage 5: 3y 9m 4w
End: 4y 1m 1w

RedShortsApe
Stage 2: 10m 4w
Stage 3: 2y 0m 4w
Stage 4: 3y 2m 4w
Stage 5: 4y 1m 2w
End: 4y 4m 3w

Joker (the error control)
Stage 2: 8m 1w
Stage 3: 1y 6m 3w
Stage 4: 2y 5m 2w
Stage 5: 3y 1m 1w
End: 3y 3m 4w

The joker's life matched previous findings.

In the 4+ years of resting I managed to finish getting all 4 of the "girl friends."

Yuri in Togle
Readme in Ryuwn
Chiho in Torble
Laurier in Vizley

Just as posted I got them in that order by spending every available weekend visiting and talking to them. Their apearance changed and so did their responces when you talk to them (although only slightly). It should be noted that my breeder fame is not 100 everywhere so it is safe to say fame is not a factor.

Also of note:
I "trained" (more like rested) all four of the monsters together with no gadgets or affects on the ranch, and at the same starting time.

I only fed them mushrooms when all four reached "OK" (instead of "lively"). This is about 4 weeks of no feeding followed by one week of food. They all stayed Normal Form until 3 years at which point all four became "Chubby" the next time I fed them I fed all four vitamins instead of mushrooms. Then they were all normal and I fed them mushrooms just as before. At 4y and 2m the two remaining monsters (Ape and Ogyo) became chubby and I fed them vitamins a second and final time. This didn't have any affect on the Jokers life and I only spent about $6,000 on food this way. They spent nearly their entire lives Normal form and Lenient.

I also watched their friendships which were all "Great friends" by 2y 0m 2w but never became "Best friends". The joker and ripper who were both "Cool" monsters always became the next level of friends before the others joined them.

Hope this helps and the lifespan table gets completed!
